verses.verse: Book III(230 73-89)Plea for Relief from Oppressors A Psalm of Asaph. (Ps 51.10; 86.5) Truly God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
(Ps 94.18) But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled; my steps had nearly slipped.
(Ps 37.1; Jer 12.1) For I was envious of the arrogant; I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For they have no pain; their bodies are sound and sleek.
(Job 21.9) They are not in trouble as others are; they are not plagued like other people.
(Ps 109.18) Therefore pride is their necklace; violence covers them like a garment.
(Job 15.27; Ps 17.10) Their eyes swell out with fatness; their hearts overflow with follies.
(Ps 53.1; Jude 16) They scoff and speak with malice; loftily they threaten oppression.
They set their mouths against heaven, and their tongues range over the earth.
Therefore the people turn and praise them (Cn: Heb his people return here) and find no fault in them. (Cn: Heb abundant waters are drained by them)
(Job 22.13) And they say, “How can God know? Is there knowledge in the Most High?”
(Ps 49.6; Jer 49.31) Such are the wicked; always at ease, they increase in riches.
(Job 21.15; Ps 26.6) All in vain I have kept my heart clean and washed my hands in innocence.
(Ps 38.6; 118.18) For all day long I have been plagued and am punished every morning.
If I had said, “I will talk on in this way,” I would have been untrue to the circle of your children.
(Eccl 8.17) But when I thought how to understand this, it seemed to me a wearisome task,
(Ps 77.13) until I went into the sanctuary of God; then I perceived their end.
(Ps 35.6, 8) Truly you set them in slippery places; you make them fall to ruin.
(Num 26.21; Job 18.11) How they are destroyed in a moment, swept away utterly by terrors!
(1 Sam 2.30; Job 20.8) They are (Cn: Heb Lord) like a dream when one awakes; on awaking you despise their phantoms.
When my soul was embittered, when I was pricked in heart,
(Job 18.3; Ps 49.10) I was stupid and ignorant; I was like a brute beast toward you.
Nevertheless, I am continually with you; you hold my right hand.
(Ps 32.8; 48.14) You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will receive me with honor. (Or to glory)
(Phil 3.8) Whom have I in heaven but you? And there is nothing on earth that I desire other than you.
(Ps 16.5; 84.2) My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength (Heb rock) of my heart and my portion forever.
(Ps 37.20) Indeed, those who are far from you will perish; you put an end to those who are false to you.
(Ps 40.5; 71.7; Heb 10.22) But for me it is good to be near God; I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, to tell of all your works.
